English:
Darn it, [p]!
You're late again! I knew you'd be late!
Chinese:
可惡！　[p]！
你又這麼晚來了！你每次動作都這麼慢！
Korean:
야―! [p]―!
또 늦었어! 역시 늦었어!
German:
Verflixt, [p]!
Du bist schon wieder zu spät!
Ich hab’s genau gewusst!

English:
What would you have done if some creeper had come
on to me like before?!
Chinese:
如果我跟之前一樣，又被怪人搭訕，
你說該怎麼辦才好啊！？
Korean:
저번처럼, 또 이상한 녀석들에게
헌팅 같은 걸 당하면 어떡하려고 그래!?
German:
Was wäre denn, wenn mich wieder jemand angebaggert
hätte wie vorher?!

English:
There's no need to worry.
No one's coming on to you.
I won't let that happen!
Chinese:
妳不用白擔心了。
妳才不會被搭訕。
我不會讓這種事發生的！
Korean:
걱정하지 않아도 괜찮아
헌팅 같은 건 안 당할 거야
그런 짓은 용서 못해!
German:
Mach dir keine Sorgen.
Niemand ist hier am Baggern.
Das lasse ich nicht zu!

English:
What? Hang on... What?
And just what do you mean by that?!
Chinese:
嗯？等……
你是什麼意思！？
Korean:
에? 잠깐… 무슨…
그거 무슨 의미야!?
German:
Wie? Moment mal ... Was?
Was genau soll das heißen?!

English: Hey, Nokia, what's a come on?
Chinese: 諾奇雅，「搭訕」是什麼啊？
Korean: 저기 노키아,「헌팅」이 뭐야?
German: He, Nokia. Was heißt denn anbaggern?

English: Oh, right... Um, that's when...
Chinese: 啊啊……嗯，所謂的搭訕就是……
Korean: 아아… 그, 헌팅이란 건 말이지…
German: Oh, ja ... Ähm, das heißt ....

English:
It's this kind of, um, courtship ritual that some
idiotic males do when they're after a sexy cute
bod like mine.
Chinese:
愚蠢的雄性動物，看中我性感又可愛的身體，
想要偷嘗禁忌果實的一種祭典……
Korean:
내 에로귀염보디를 노리고서
어리석은 수컷들이 펼치는, 금단의 과실 같은 제전이야…
German:
Es ist eine Art Balzritual bestimmter Trottel,
wenn sie jemanden wie mich zu Gesicht bekommen.

English:
I'm not sure I quite get that, but it sounds
pretty scary.
Chinese:
雖然聽不懂，
但是好像很可怕……
Korean:
뭐, 뭔지 잘 모르겠지만
무서워 보이네…
German:
So ganz verstehe ich das nicht, aber es klingt
ziemlich furchteinflößend.

English:
Yes, it is scary.
But if the guy is hot, I might be okay with it...
Chinese:
沒錯，非常可怕……
不過如果對方是帥哥的話就沒問題……
Korean:
맞아, 무서워…
단, 미남에게만은 용서가 돼…
German:
Ja, das kann es schon sein.
Manche können das aber auch nett ...

English: What are you talking about?
Chinese: 妳在說什麼……？
Korean: ……넌, 대체 무슨 얘기를 하는 거지?
German: Wovon sprecht ihr denn?

English: Whoa! Yuugo!
Chinese: 啊啊！是YUGO！！
Korean: 하으아! 유, 유고!!
German: Hoppla! Yuugo!

English:
What, ah, what a coincidence, running into you
like this! What terrific luck I have!
Chinese:
居然會在這裡遇到，
真巧！太幸運了！
Korean:
이, 이런 곳에서 갑자기 만나다니
완전 우연! 완전 럭키!
German:
Was für ein Zufall, dass du uns begegnest!
Was ich doch für ein Glück habe!

English:
It's like this chance encounter was destined to
happen! I was just thinking I wanted to talk to
you about something, too!
Chinese:
我覺得這個巧合就像命運安排的！
正好我有話想跟你說！
Korean:
이 우연, 좀 운명 같은 게 느껴지는걸, 나!
마침 너에게 하고 싶은 말이 있었어!
German:
Als ob diese Begegnung vorbestimmt wäre!
Ich habe auch gerade daran gedacht, dass ich
etwas mit dir besprechen möchte!

English: I understand what you were saying.
Chinese: 我懂妳的意思了。
Korean: …네 주장은 이해했다
German: Ich verstehe, was du meinst.

English: Good!
Chinese: 嗯！
Korean: 응!
German: Gut!

English: Zaxon solidarity has been more tepid lately.
Chinese: 的確……最近的Zaxon很像一盤散沙。
Korean: 확실히 최근의 잭슨은 결속이 느슨해졌어
German:
Mit dem Zusammenhalt bei Zaxon ist es in letzter
Zeit nicht mehr so weit her.

English: Good, good!
Chinese: 嗯嗯！
Korean: 응응!
German: Ausgezeichnet!

English:
A number of us are acting so brashly as to draw
interest from other hacker teams.
Chinese:
還有很多駭客……
做出讓其他隊伍的駭客看不順眼的行動……
Korean:
다른 팀의 해커들 중에서도
묵과할 수 없는 행동을 하는 자들이 눈에 띄어…
German:
Einige von uns sind sogar so dreist, dass sie
andere Hacker-Teams auf uns aufmerksam machen.

English: Good, good, good!
Chinese: 嗯嗯嗯！
Korean: 응응응!
German: Ganz hervorragend!

English:
But don't you think pitting power against power
will only result in unneeded chaos?
Chinese:
可是妳不覺得以暴制暴，
只會讓事情變得更混亂嗎？
Korean:
하지만, 힘에 힘으로 대항해도
괜한 혼란을 낳을 뿐이라고는 생각하지 않나?
German:
Aber glaubst du nicht, dass es nur unnötiges
Chaos erzeugt, wenn du eine Kraft gegen die
andere richtest?

English: Huh?
Korean: …흐엣!?
German: Hä?

English:
Someone needs to reunite the hackers of Kowloon,
and restore EDEN to its former state of order.
Chinese:
要讓Kowloon裡的駭客再次團結，
恢復EDEN秩序的人……
Korean:
이 쿠롱에서, 다시 한 번 해커들을 바로잡아
EDEN에 과거의 질서를 부활시킨다…
German:
Jemand muss die Hacker von Kowloon wieder vereinen
und Ordnung in EDEN wiederherstellen.

English: But that someone is not you, Nokia.
Chinese: 不是妳。
Korean: 그 역할을 다하는 건 네가 아니야
German: Aber du bist nicht dieser Jemand, Nokia.

English: It's me.
Chinese: 而是我。
Korean: …나다
German: Sondern ich.

English:
WHAAAAAAAT?!
H-Hang on! Wait a sec!
Chinese:
咦咦咦咦咦！？
等……等一下！
Korean:
에에에에에에에에에!?
자, 잠깐, 기다려!
German:
WAAAS?!
Moment mal! Augenblick!

English:
What the what?!
I'm completely lost!
Chinese:
什麼跟什麼嘛！
每個人都是一個樣！
Korean:
뭐야뭐야뭐야!
이 녀석이고 저 녀석이고 정말!
German:
Was zum ...?!
Jetzt verstehe ich gar nichts mehr!

English:
But I CAN do it!
Can't I, [p]?!
Chinese:
我也辦得到啊！
對吧！？[p]！？
Korean:
나도 할 수 있다고!!
그렇지!? [p]!?
German:
Aber ich KANN das doch!
Meinst du nicht, [p]?!

English:
Of course!
No, probably not.
No comment!
Chinese:
當然！
不行吧。
不予置評。
Korean:
물론!
아니 힘들겠지
노 코멘트로
German:
Natürlich!
Nein, eher nicht.
Kein Kommentar!

English:
Aaaaaack!
Now I'm totally desperate! This is the pits!
Chinese:
啊——————！！
既然這樣，我要自暴自棄！
Korean:
아아아――――――!!
이렇게 된 이상 자포자기야! 자포자기라구!
German:
Aaargh!
Jetzt bin ich wirklich arm dran! Das ist das
Letzte!

English:
I'll just go around Kowloon soliciting any and all
hackers I happen to come across!
Chinese:
在Kowloon裡的駭客，
我要遇一個招一個！
Korean:
쿠롱에 있는 해커들에게
닥치는 대로 권유할 거야!
German:
Ich gehe einfach in Kowloon rum und bitte alle
Hacker, denen ich begegne, um Hilfe!

English:
Then I'll have, like, a buttload of hackers with 
me, and we'll beat the others at their own game!
Chinese:
我要招集超多同伴，
給那群人好看！！
Korean:
동료를 무진장무진장 잔뜩 모아서
그 녀석들이 날 다시 보게 만들 거야!!
German:
Dann hab ich einen ganzen Haufen Hacker bei mir
und wir schlagen die anderen mit ihren eigenen
Waffen!

English:
Yeeee-hawwwwww!
Follow in Akkino's footsteps, folks! Follow me!
Chinese:
唔喔喔喔喔————！
跟著本姑娘雅奇諾來吧——！
Korean:
우오오오오오――――!
이 나를, 앗키노 씨를 따라라아아아――!
German:
Ju-huuu!
Immer Akkino nach, Leute!
